alert.note: Alert for Laramie (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Snow Squall Warning issued February 06 at 7:11PM MST until February 06 at 7:45PM MST by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: The National Weather Service in Cheyenne has issued a * Snow Squall Warning for... Southeastern Laramie County in southeastern Wyoming... * Until 745 PM MST. * At 711 PM MST, a dangerous snow squall was located along a line extending from 6 miles northeast of Hillsdale to near Ranchettes, moving southeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Intense bursts of heavy snow. Gusty winds leading to blowing snow and visibility rapidly falling to less than one-quarter mile. Wind gusts up to 35 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Travel will become difficult and potentially dangerous within minutes. This includes Interstate 80 in Wyoming between mile markers 366 and 388. Locations impacted include... Cheyenne, Burns, Hillsdale, Carpenter and Ranchettes. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Slow Down! Rapid changes in visibility and road conditions are expected with this dangerous snow squall. Be alert for sudden whiteout conditions.
